text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5e8707dc6f703f00048b67bd|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-25" to "rebecca-and-adrian"
name: rebecca-and-adrian

text:
Hey Adrian, please meet Rebecca your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or penny-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m Rebecca, I’m a jnr lookdev artist at Blue Zoo - I’m originally from Belfast and student at Ulster University:)
Hi Rebecca! I'm a student at the University of Hertfordshire and I want to specialise in modelling, texturing and lookdev for vfx films. I'm originally from London. Nice to meet you :smile:
If you don't mind me asking, how was it coming out of uni and going to work in industry? I'm in my final year at the moment but i've never had an an internship or any industry experience.

Hey! I’m actually working with an ex student at that uni- Lisa-mae Evans?

Nice! Pretty much what I’m into to- although I work at BZ with a lot more kid friendly/stylised work- it’s mainly modelling that’s stylised - our shaders tend to be done to match real life references :) 

So I have a weird back story! I originally studied Biomedical Science with Pathology and switched to a animation degree. It wasn’t a great uni so I was super lucky to know a lot of people and get feedback and advice from them.

My uni has a placement year- the scene in Belfast was big for 2d productions and I was a production coordinator/generalist in house for a year 
I was lucky to go back their after graduating to act as a generalist on a Cartoon Forum pilot - which help bulked out my reel
My boyfriend is a groom artist at MPC so I knew a lot of his friends and I’m a big networker so I know people all over the world industry wise (which surprises a lot of people :joy:) and then I was recommended for a production assistant job there- were I worked with a great team 
I love the people there and although a lot of people have moved on we still keep in touch (we have been holding a Friday night VFX pub through Zoom which has been amazing)
After that I interviewed for blue zoo and have been working there from January :) 

In all honesty it’s been terrifying - I had a 12 week contract at MPC before the “purge” and redundancies and had to act quickly to get another job 

The industry hasn’t been stable for the last year and the competition is huge! That’s why I like companies like blue zoo where they treat people well

My boyfriend has worked at mpc for nearly 3 years now and he’s had a great experience there- they sent him to Bangalore and Montreal to train staff- and have moved him to previs to ensure he had a secure enough job when they were not renewing contracts at Christmas time

Ah yeah Lisa, I got a chance to work with her team last year. It was pretty fun :D
That's awesome! Yeah I'm doing a digi-double of one of my lecturers in uni at the moment. I'm working with a mate who's doing the groom. Texturing and Lookdev isn't my strongest avenue but I don't think i'm terrible haha
What made you want to switch from bio science to animation? They're both quite different disciplines :open_mouth:
Yeah its definitely nice to know that being in this industry, artists seem to know everyone  from everywhere The community seems very friendly and supportive which is nice
Yeah from word of mouth I heard MPCs kinda not the best when it comes to contracts haha though I really wanna work there some day :joy: Given such short contracts seems like such a scary thing :sweat_smile:
I seem to get the impression that smaller companies are a lot nicer to their artists but idk
Ah its cool you've worked at big and small companies. Would you say you have  a preference over which kind of companies you'd rather work for now?

I loved biomed and loved the learning but found it super boring and the idea of stuck behind a microscope every day just didn’t appeal to me 

To be honest I’d rather work somewhere secure - knowing I can plan for say a year contract (which I’m on a Blue Zoo) to a 12 week one
I’ve learnt a lot in the last few months and I’m only starting! For me moving from the smaller companies in Belfast was because I wasted to learn more and work with a lead who had experience - like I’m already finding I’m solving problems I would never have been able to before

Like MPC has some bad rep- but the people who work there were fantastic and it by far was my favourite in terms of people and personalities 

Nice! Do you have any renders of you work/head- I’m normally a very good online sleuth and found a website with a creature from last year!
